siteMetadata.title: Colm Doyle
siteMetadata.subtitle: Thoughts on Technology, Developer Relations and more.

frontmatter.title: Building for the new normal
frontmatter.description: In a world where we no longer move from desk to meeting room and back, what do we need to change about the tools we build so they help us to achieve our common goals at work?

frontmatter.title: The real perk
frontmatter.description: Tech companies do a fantastic job on their career sites of talking about all the amazing perks they offer. Free food as far as the eye can see, the latest hardware and eye-popping salaries. But at the best companies, the real perk is something else.

frontmatter.title: Families and Tech Companies
frontmatter.description: I’ve just finished reading Disrupted by Dan Lyons. Apart from finding it hilarious, which I did, it offers a somewhat scathing critique of how a modern technology company operates.

frontmatter.title: It’s time to get rid of traditional release notes
frontmatter.description: Bug fixes and various improvments. I'm willing to bet that almost every app update installed on your device in the last 12 months has had that exact set of release notes, or something extremely similar.
